intro: Dryandra formosa, commonly known as the pink dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, pinkish-red flower spikes. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It is a shrub that can grow up to 2 meters in height, featuring narrow, needle-like leaves. Dryandra formosa is adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
